I am a three-digit number. My tens digit is five more than my units digit, and my hundreds digit is eight less than my tens digit. What number am I?
I am a two-digit number. My tens digit is three times the units digit, and the sum of my digits is equal to 12. What number am I?
I am a two-digit number. My tens digit is twice my units digit, and if you subtract my units digit from my tens digit, the result is 4. What number am I?
I am a two-digit number. My tens digit is four less than my units digit and if you add my digits together, the result is ten. What number am I?

I am a four-digit number. My thousands digit is three times my hundreds digit, my tens digit is one less than my hundreds digit, and my units digit is the sum of my thousands and tens digits. What number am I?
I am a number that's greater than ten, but less than a hundred too. My tens digit is half of my units, and the sum of my digits is twenty - can you tell me who?
I can be cracked, made, told, and played; I can be long or short, but I'm always displayed. What am I?

I am a number with a curious fate.
Double me, and add four to my weight.
Subtract six, and I’ll still be bright,
My square is less than twelve times my height.
What number am I?

I have mountains and valleys, rivers and lakes,
I am split into countries, with borders that make.
Some call me a continent, large and proud,
Where many call home, in crowds or alone.
What am I?

I am a two-digit number with a special link.  
My units digit is three times my tens, think!  
If you add my digits, they perfectly equal ten,  
What number am I, can you figure the pen?

I can be found in books, but I'm not alive,  
I carry stories, where wonders thrive.  
I have pages and words, yet I do not speak,  
In a world of knowledge, I am unique.  
What am I?

I can be long or short, I can be fast or slow,  
I can bring you joy or leave you feeling low.  
You can give me your time, but please don’t waste me,  
For I am something that everyone can see.  
What am I?
I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I can deliver fears. What am I?

I am a three-digit number, bright and neat.  
My hundreds digit is two times my units, what a feat!  
If you add my digits, the result is ten.  
Tell me, what number am I, my friend?

I have keys but open no locks,  
I have space but no room,  
You can enter, but you can't go outside,  
What am I?

I am a two-digit number, that's what I'll say.  
My tens digit is one more than twice my units, so clever and gray.  
If you multiply my digits, the result is also true;  
The product is equal to six, can you guess who?

I am a three-digit number, not too hard to see.  
My hundreds digit is four less than my tens, you see.  
My tens digit is half of my units, that's right!  
Add all my digits, and you’ll find a sum that is bright.  
What number am I?

I am a word of letters three,  
Add two more to rescue me.  
In oceans deep, I may be found,  
A floating life where waves abound.  
What am I?

I am a two-digit number, my units digit and tens digit are far from same.  
If you multiply my digits, they make eight just the same.  
Also, if you swap my digits, the new number is two less than my original name.  
What number am I?

I am a vast expanse that stretches far and wide,  
Covering 71% of Earth, where mysteries hide.  
I am home to creatures both great and small,  
With tides that ebb and flow; some call me a ball.  
What am I?

I am a line of code, precise and neat,  
In the world of Python, I can't be beat.  
I help you loop, compare, or repeat,  
Without me, your logic is incomplete.  
What am I?

I am a two-digit number, can you see?  
My units digit is twice the tens, and as it may be.  
If you subtract my tens from my units with glee,  
The answer will be three, so think carefully.  
What number am I?

I can make you dance, or bring a tear,  
With melodies sweet, and rhythms clear.  
I have my verses, my chorus too,  
Sung by many, including you.  
What am I?

"Hello from the other side,  
I must have called a thousand times,  
To tell you I'm sorry for everything that I've done,  
But when I call you never seem to be home."  
What song am I?
